required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Nexavar/Placebo as Maintenance Therapy for Patients With Advanced Ovarian or Primary Peritoneal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized Phase II Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Sorafenib Compared to Placebo in Ovarian Epithelial Cancer or Primary Peritoneal Cancer Patients Who Have Achieved a Complete Clinical Response After Standard Platinum/Taxane Containing Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of Nexavar with a placebo as maintenance therapy for patients with advanced Ovarian or primary Peritoneal cancers in complete remission following surgery and one regimen of chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival (PFS), Based on Radiological or Pathologic Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first patient until 32.5 months later, assessed every 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first documented disease progression by radiological or pathologic assessment or death due to any cause whichever occurred first. For patients who had not progressed or died at the time of analysis, PFS was censored at the date of their last evaluable tumor scan.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Pathologic CA-125 (Cancer-associated Tumor Marker) Serum Level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first patient until 32.5 months later, assessed every 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first documented increase of CA-125 above the upper limit of normal. Patients without pathologic CA-125 increase at the time of analysis were censored at their last date of evaluation of CA-125.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first patient until 32.5 months later
secondary_outcome.description: The OS time was measured from the date of randomization until the date of death due to any cause. Patients who were alive at the time of analysis were censored at the date of the last contact (last time the patient was known to be alive).

other_outcome.measure: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT)/National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Ovarian Symptom Index (FOSI) Total Score at Cycle 1/Baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 1 (4 weeks per Cycle)/baseline
other_outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The FOSI total score ranges from 0 (severely symptomatic) to 32 (asymptomatic).

other_outcome.measure: FOSI Total Score at Cycle 3
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 3 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The FOSI total score ranges from 0 (severely symptomatic) to 32 (asymptomatic).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FOSI Total Score at Cycle 3
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 3 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The change is calculated as score at Cycle 3 minus baseline score. The change in FOSI total score ranges from -32 (most deterioration from baseline) to 32 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: FOSI Total Score at Cycle 5
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 5 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The FOSI total score ranges from 0 (severely symptomatic) to 32 (asymptomatic).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FOSI Total Score at Cycle 5
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 5 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The change is calculated as score at Cycle 5 minus baseline score. The change in FOSI total score ranges from -32 (most deterioration from baseline) to 32 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: FOSI Total Score at End of Treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: At End of treatment (up to Cycle 33, 4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The FOSI total score ranges from 0 (severely symptomatic) to 32 (asymptomatic).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FOSI Total Score at End of Treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of treatment (up to Cycle 33, 4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The change is calculated as score at End of treatment minus baseline score. The change in FOSI total score ranges from -32 (most deterioration from baseline) to 32 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) Index Score at Cycle 1/Baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 1 (4 weeks per Cycle)/baseline
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index score which ranges from -0.594 (worst) to 1 (best) when the United Kingdom (UK) weights are applied.

other_outcome.measure: EQ-5D Index Score at Cycle 3
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 3 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index score which ranges from -0.594 (worst) to 1 (best) when the United Kingdom (UK) weights are applied.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Index Score at Cycle 3
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 3 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index. The change is calculated as score at Cycle 3 minus baseline score. The change in EQ-5D index ranges from -1.594 (most deterioration from baseline) to 1.594 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: EQ-5D Index Score at Cycle 5
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 5 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index score which ranges from -0.594 (worst) to 1 (best) when the United Kingdom (UK) weights are applied.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Index Score at Cycle 5
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 5 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index. The change is calculated as score at Cycle 5 minus baseline score. The change in EQ-5D index ranges from -1.594 (most deterioration from baseline) to 1.594 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: EQ-5D Index Score at End of Treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: At End of treatment (up to Cycle 33, 4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index score which ranges from -0.594 (worst) to 1 (best) when the United Kingdom (UK) weights are applied.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Index Score at End of Treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of treatment (up to Cycle 33, 4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index. The change is calculated as score at End of treatment minus baseline score. The change in EQ-5D index ranges from -1.594 (most deterioration from baseline) to 1.594 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: EQ-5D Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score at Cycle 1/Baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 1 (4 weeks per Cycle)/baseline
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D also contains a VAS, which records the respondent's self-rated health status on a vertical graduated scale. The scale ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state).

other_outcome.measure: EQ-5D VAS Score at Cycle 3
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 3 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D also contains a VAS, which records the respondent's self-rated health status on a vertical graduated scale. The scale ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D VAS Score at Cycle 3
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 3 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D also contains a VAS, which records the respondent's self-rated health status on a vertical graduated scale. The change is calculated as score at Cycle 3 minus baseline score. The change in EQ-5D VAS ranges from -100 (most deterioration from baseline) to 100 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: EQ-5D VAS Score at Cycle 5
other_outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 5 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D also contains a VAS, which records the respondent's self-rated health status on a vertical graduated scale. The scale ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D VAS Score at Cycle 5
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 5 (4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D also contains a VAS, which records the respondent's self-rated health status on a vertical graduated scale. The change is calculated as score at Cycle 5 minus baseline score. The change in EQ-5D VAS ranges from -100 (most deterioration from baseline) to 100 (most improvement from baseline).

other_outcome.measure: EQ-5D VAS Score at End of Treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: At End of treatment (up to Cycle 33, 4 weeks per Cycle)
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D also contains a VAS, which records the respondent's self-rated health status on a vertical graduated scale. The scale ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state).

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of treatment (up to Cycle 33, 4 weeks per Cycle)

The change is calculated as score at End of treatment minus baseline score. The change in EQ-5D VAS ranges from -100 (most deterioration from baseline) to 100 (most improvement from baseline).

arm_group.description: Participants received 2 sorafenib tablets (200 mg each) per oral twice daily (bid)
Participants received 2 matching placebo tablets per oral twice daily

intervention.description: Patients in Sorafenib arm will receive 2 Sorafenib tablets (200 mg each) twice a day and in continuous administration.
Patients in Placebo arm will receive 2 matching placebo tablets twice a day and in continuous administration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) stage (67) III or IV ovarian epithelial cancer or primary peritoneal cancer at presentation. Patients must have achieved a clinical complete response (disappearance of all clinical and radiological evidence of tumor) after only one regimen (4-6 cycles) of platinum and taxane-based standard chemotherapy received after tumor debulkment.
- Normal serum CA125 (cancer-associated tumor marker) level within 7 days of first dose of sorafenib.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1.
- All scans used to document complete response must be done within 30 days prior to randomization.
- Patients must be able to swallow and retain oral medication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with any residual cancer tissue after the completion of chemotherapy detectable by standard Computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
- Prior local radiotherapy, neoadjuvant chemotherapy or intraperitoneal chemotherapy.
- Histologic subtypes of ovarian cancer other than epithelial (i.e. sarcoma, lymphoma, germ cell).
- Major surgery, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 30 days prior to randomization.

results_reference.citation: Herzog TJ, Scambia G, Kim BG, Lhommé C, Markowska J, Ray-Coquard I, Sehouli J, Colombo N, Shan M, Petrenciuc O, Oza A. A randomized phase II trial of maintenance therapy with Sorafenib in front-line ovarian carcinoma. Gynecol Oncol. 2013 Jul;130(1):25-30. doi: 10.1016/j.ygyno.2013.04.011. Epub 2013 Apr 13.

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)
group.description: Participants received 2 sorafenib tablets (200 mg each) per oral twice daily (bid)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received 2 matching placebo tablets per oral twice daily

participants_list.participants: includes: 42 subjects with progression, 4 subjects transferred to a continuation study
Includes 79 participants with study follow-up terminated by sponsor and 16 deaths
Includes 78 participants with study follow-up terminated by sponsor and 12 deaths

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)
group.description: Participants received 2 sorafenib tablets (200 mg each) per oral twice daily (bid)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received 2 matching placebo tablets per oral twice daily

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Gender
Performance status, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG)
measure.description: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status is a scale that measures how cancer affects the daily life of a patient on an ordinal scale from grade 0 (best) to grade 5 (worst).

measure.title: Type of cancer
measure.description: Patients were to have either ovarian epithelial cancer or primary peritoneal cancer. Primary peritoneal carcinoma involves the extra-ovarian peritoneum significantly and the ovarian surface minimally or not at all.

measure.title: Previous Intra-peritoneal (IP) chemotherapy
measure.description: The presence or absence of any IP chemotherapy before enrollment into the study.

measure.title: Surgical cytoreduction
measure.description: The degree of residual disease following initial diagnosis and surgical debulkment: optimal surgical cytoreduction (any/each lesion remaining after surgery ≤1 cm) or suboptimal surgical cytoreduction (any/each lesion remaining after surgery >1cm)

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS), Based on Radiological or Pathologic Assessment
outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first documented disease progression by radiological or pathologic assessment or death due to any cause whichever occurred first. For patients who had not progressed or died at the time of analysis, PFS was censored at the date of their last evaluable tumor scan.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first patient until 32.5 months later, assessed every 8 weeks
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)=all randomized participants

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)
group.description: Participants received 2 sorafenib tablets (200 mg each) per oral twice daily (bid)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received 2 matching placebo tablets per oral twice daily

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS), Based on Radiological or Pathologic Assessment
measure.description: Time from randomization to the first documented disease progression by radiological or pathologic assessment or death due to any cause whichever occurred first. For patients who had not progressed or died at the time of analysis, PFS was censored at the date of their last evaluable tumor scan.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)=all randomized participants

analysis.groups_desc: Sample size based on the primary efficacy endpoint of PFS. Clinically meaningful improvement defined as 65% increase in median PFS. With one-sided alpha of 0.10, power of 90% and a randomization ratio of 1:1 between Sorafenib and Placebo, a total of 105 PFS events were required.
analysis.method_desc: Two treatment groups compared using a log-rank test with one-sided alpha of 0.10 stratified by the same factors as randomization

outcome.title: Time to First Pathologic CA-125 (Cancer-associated Tumor Marker) Serum Level
outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first documented increase of CA-125 above the upper limit of normal. Patients without pathologic CA-125 increase at the time of analysis were censored at their last date of evaluation of CA-125.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first patient until 32.5 months later, assessed every 8 weeks
outcome.population: Per protocol set (PPS)=all randomized participants who had normal CA-125 serum level at baseline and at least one post-baseline CA-125 assessment

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)

outcome.title: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT)/National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Ovarian Symptom Index (FOSI) Total Score at Cycle 1/Baseline
outcome.description: The FOSI is an 8-item index derived from the FACT-Ovarian Cancer (FACT-O) to measure symptom response to treatment for ovarian cancer. The FOSI total score ranges from 0 (severely symptomatic) to 32 (asymptomatic).
outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 1 (4 weeks per Cycle)/baseline
outcome.population: Patient-reported outcomes (PRO) analysis set=the FAS population with evaluable PRO assessments at baseline and at least one post-baseline assessment

measure.title: EQ-5D Index Score at Cycle 3
measure.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index score which ranges from -0.594 (worst) to 1 (best) when the United Kingdom (UK) weights are applied.
measure.population: PRO analysis set=the FAS population with evaluable PRO assessments at baseline and at Cycle 3

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Index Score at Cycle 3
outcome.description: The EQ-5D contains a descriptive system which measures 5 health dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. These five health dimensions are summarized into a single score, the EQ-5D index. The change is calculated as score at Cycle 3 minus baseline score. The change in EQ-5D index ranges from -1.594 (most deterioration from baseline) to 1.594 (most improvement from baseline).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 3 (4 weeks per Cycle)
outcome.population: PRO analysis set=the FAS population with evaluable PRO assessments at baseline and at Cycle 3

outcome.title: EQ-5D Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score at Cycle 1/Baseline
outcome.description: The EQ-5D also contains a VAS, which records the respondent’s self-rated health status on a vertical graduated scale. The scale ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state).
outcome.time_frame: At Cycle 1 (4 weeks per Cycle)/baseline
outcome.population: PRO analysis set=the FAS population with evaluable PRO assessments at baseline and at least one post-baseline assessment

reported_events.time_frame: From the start of treatment up to 30 days after last study drug administration.
reported_events.desc: Acronyms used: Gastrointestinal (GI), Genitourinary (GU), Not Otherwise Specified (NOS), Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC), Aspartate aminotransferase (AST), Alanine aminotransferase (ALT), Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE)

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)
group.description: Participants received 2 sorafenib tablets (200 mg each) per oral twice daily (bid)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received 2 matching placebo tablets per oral twice daily

event.sub_title: Infection with normal ANC, Urinary tract NOS

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Secondary Malignancy (possibly related to cancer treatment)
Infection with unknown ANC, Upper airway NOS

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
